description: Words of Jesus Christ (red letter edition)
note: This contains the actual words spoken by Jesus in each verse. For verses where Jesus speaks the entire verse, the value is 'full'. For partial verses, the exact quoted words are provided.

verses.Matthew 3:15: Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness.
verses.Matthew 4:4: It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
verses.Matthew 4:7: It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.Matthew 4:10: Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.Matthew 4:17: Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.Matthew 4:19: Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
verses.Matthew 8:4: See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.Matthew 8:7: I will come and heal him.
verses.Matthew 8:10: Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
verses.Matthew 8:13: Go thy way; and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee.
verses.Matthew 8:20: The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
verses.Matthew 8:22: Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.
verses.Matthew 8:26: Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith?
verses.Matthew 9:2: Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.
verses.Matthew 9:4: Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?
verses.Matthew 9:12: They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
verses.Matthew 9:15: Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
verses.Matthew 9:22: Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.Matthew 9:24: Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.Matthew 9:28: Believe ye that I am able to do this?
verses.Matthew 9:29: According to your faith be it unto you.
verses.Matthew 9:30: See that no man know it.
verses.Matthew 11:4: Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:
verses.Matthew 11:17: We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
verses.Matthew 11:25: I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.
verses.Matthew 12:3: Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;
verses.Matthew 12:11: What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?
verses.Matthew 12:39: An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:
verses.Matthew 12:48: Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?
verses.Matthew 13:29: Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.
verses.Matthew 13:51: Have ye understood all these things?
verses.Matthew 13:52: Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old.
verses.Matthew 13:57: A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.
verses.Matthew 14:16: They need not depart; give ye them to eat.
verses.Matthew 14:27: Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.
verses.Matthew 14:31: O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?
verses.Matthew 15:3: Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
verses.Matthew 15:13: Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
verses.Matthew 15:16: Are ye also yet without understanding?
verses.Matthew 15:24: I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.Matthew 15:26: It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it to dogs.
verses.Matthew 15:28: O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt.
verses.Matthew 16:6: Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
verses.Matthew 16:8: O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?
verses.Matthew 16:13: Whom do men say that I the Son of man am?
verses.Matthew 16:15: But whom say ye that I am?
verses.Matthew 16:17: Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-jona: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.
verses.Matthew 16:23: Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.
verses.Matthew 16:24: If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.Matthew 17:9: Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.
verses.Matthew 17:11: Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.
verses.Matthew 17:17: O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.
verses.Matthew 17:20: Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.
verses.Matthew 17:22: The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:
verses.Matthew 17:25: What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?
verses.Matthew 18:3: Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.Matthew 18:22: I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.
verses.Matthew 19:4: Have ye not read, that he which made them at the beginning made them male and female,
verses.Matthew 19:5: For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?
verses.Matthew 19:8: Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.
verses.Matthew 19:11: All men cannot receive this saying, save they to whom it is given.
verses.Matthew 19:14: Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.Matthew 19:17: Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.
verses.Matthew 19:18: Thou shalt do no murder, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,
verses.Matthew 19:21: If thou wilt be perfect, go and sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come and follow me.
verses.Matthew 19:23: Verily I say unto you, That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.Matthew 19:26: With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
verses.Matthew 19:28: Verily I say unto you, That ye which have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.Matthew 20:12: These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.
verses.Matthew 20:13: Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?
verses.Matthew 20:22: Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
verses.Matthew 20:23: Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father.
verses.Matthew 20:32: What will ye that I shall do unto you?
verses.Matthew 21:2: Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.
verses.Matthew 21:13: It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.Matthew 21:16: Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?
verses.Matthew 21:19: Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever.
verses.Matthew 21:21: Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.
verses.Matthew 21:24: I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.Matthew 21:27: Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.Matthew 21:29: I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.
verses.Matthew 21:30: I go, sir: and went not.
verses.Matthew 21:31: Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
verses.Matthew 21:42: Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
verses.Matthew 22:12: Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment?
verses.Matthew 22:18: Why tempt ye me, ye hypocrites?
verses.Matthew 22:20: Whose is this image and superscription?
verses.Matthew 22:21: Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's.
verses.Matthew 22:29: Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.
verses.Matthew 22:37: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
verses.Matthew 22:42: What think ye of Christ? whose son is he?
verses.Matthew 22:43: How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,
verses.Matthew 23:2: The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat:
verses.Matthew 24:2: See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.Matthew 24:4: Take heed that no man deceive you.
verses.Matthew 25:12: Verily I say unto you, I know you not.
verses.Matthew 26:10: Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
verses.Matthew 26:18: Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.
verses.Matthew 26:21: Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
verses.Matthew 26:23: He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.
verses.Matthew 26:26: Take, eat; this is my body.
verses.Matthew 26:34: Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.Matthew 26:36: Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.
verses.Matthew 26:38: My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.
verses.Matthew 26:40: What, could ye not watch with me one hour?
verses.Matthew 26:45: Sleep on now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.Matthew 26:52: Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.
verses.Matthew 26:64: Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
verses.Matthew 28:10: Be not afraid: go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.
verses.Mark 1:15: The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
verses.Mark 1:17: Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
verses.Mark 1:25: Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
verses.Mark 1:38: Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
verses.Mark 1:44: See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.Mark 2:5: Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.
verses.Mark 2:8: Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
verses.Mark 2:17: They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.Mark 2:19: Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.Mark 2:25: Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?
verses.Mark 2:27: The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
verses.Mark 3:4: Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?
verses.Mark 3:33: Who is my mother, or my brethren?
verses.Mark 4:9: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.Mark 4:11: Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:
verses.Mark 4:13: Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?
verses.Mark 4:21: Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?
verses.Mark 4:24: Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
verses.Mark 4:26: So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
verses.Mark 4:30: Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
verses.Mark 4:35: Let us pass over unto the other side.
verses.Mark 4:40: Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
verses.Mark 5:8: Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.
verses.Mark 5:19: Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.
verses.Mark 5:34: Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.
verses.Mark 5:39: Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.Mark 6:4: A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.
verses.Mark 6:10: In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.
verses.Mark 6:31: Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while.
verses.Mark 6:38: How many loaves have ye? go and see.
verses.Mark 6:50: Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.
verses.Mark 7:9: Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
verses.Mark 7:14: Hearken unto me every one of you, and understand:
verses.Mark 7:18: Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
verses.Mark 7:20: That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.
verses.Mark 7:27: Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it unto the dogs.
verses.Mark 7:29: For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
verses.Mark 8:15: Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.
verses.Mark 8:21: How is it that ye do not understand?
verses.Mark 8:26: Neither go into the town, nor tell it to any in the town.
verses.Mark 8:27: Whom do men say that I am?
verses.Mark 8:29: But whom say ye that I am?
verses.Mark 8:33: Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.
verses.Mark 8:34: Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.Mark 9:1: Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
verses.Mark 9:12: Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
verses.Mark 9:21: How long is it ago since this came unto him?
verses.Mark 9:23: If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
verses.Mark 9:25: Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.
verses.Mark 9:29: This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.
verses.Mark 9:33: What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?
verses.Mark 9:39: Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
verses.Mark 10:5: For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
verses.Mark 10:11: Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.
verses.Mark 10:18: Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
verses.Mark 10:29: Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,
verses.Mark 10:33: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:
verses.Mark 10:36: What would ye that I should do for you?
verses.Mark 10:38: Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
verses.Mark 10:39: Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
verses.Mark 10:51: What wilt thou that I should do unto thee?
verses.Mark 10:52: Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.Mark 11:14: No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.
verses.Mark 11:29: I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.Mark 11:33: Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.Mark 12:15: Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.
verses.Mark 12:16: Whose is this image and superscription?
verses.Mark 12:17: Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.
verses.Mark 12:29: The first of all the commandments is, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:
verses.Mark 12:34: Thou art not far from the kingdom of God.
verses.Mark 12:35: How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?
verses.Mark 12:38: Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and love salutations in the marketplaces,
verses.Mark 13:2: Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.Mark 14:6: Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
verses.Mark 14:18: Verily I say unto you, One of you which eateth with me shall betray me.
verses.Mark 14:20: It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.
verses.Mark 14:22: Take, eat: this is my body.
verses.Mark 14:24: This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.
verses.Mark 14:27: All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.
verses.Mark 14:30: Verily I say unto thee, That this day, even in this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.Mark 14:32: Sit ye here, while I shall pray.
verses.Mark 14:34: My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death: tarry ye here, and watch.
verses.Mark 14:36: Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee; take away this cup from me: nevertheless not what I will, but what thou wilt.
verses.Mark 14:37: Simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?
verses.Mark 14:41: Sleep on now, and take your rest: it is enough, the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.Mark 14:48: Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take me?
verses.Mark 14:62: I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
verses.Mark 16:6: Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.
verses.Mark 16:15: Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
verses.Luke 4:4: saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.
verses.Luke 4:8: Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.Luke 4:21: This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
verses.Luke 4:23: Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.
verses.Luke 4:24: Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.
verses.Luke 4:35: Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
verses.Luke 4:43: I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.
verses.Luke 5:4: Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
verses.Luke 5:10: Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.
verses.Luke 5:14: Tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.Luke 5:20: Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.Luke 5:22: What reason ye in your hearts?
verses.Luke 5:24: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.
verses.Luke 5:34: Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.Luke 6:5: That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
verses.Luke 6:8: Rise up, and stand forth in the midst.
verses.Luke 6:9: I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?
verses.Luke 7:9: I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
verses.Luke 7:14: Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
verses.Luke 7:40: Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee.
verses.Luke 7:50: Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.
verses.Luke 8:10: Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.
verses.Luke 8:21: My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
verses.Luke 8:22: Let us go over unto the other side of the lake.
verses.Luke 8:39: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee.
verses.Luke 8:46: Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.
verses.Luke 8:48: Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.
verses.Luke 8:50: Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.
verses.Luke 8:52: Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.Luke 9:3: Take nothing for your journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.
verses.Luke 9:14: Make them sit down by fifties in a company.
verses.Luke 9:18: Whom say the people that I am?
verses.Luke 9:20: But whom say ye that I am?
verses.Luke 9:22: The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.
verses.Luke 9:23: If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.Luke 9:41: O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.
verses.Luke 9:50: Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us.
verses.Luke 9:58: Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
verses.Luke 9:60: Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.
verses.Luke 9:62: No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
verses.Luke 10:18: I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.
verses.Luke 10:26: What is written in the law? how readest thou?
verses.Luke 10:28: Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.
verses.Luke 10:41: Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:
verses.Luke 11:2: When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.
verses.Luke 11:5: Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;
verses.Luke 11:28: Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
verses.Luke 11:39: Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
verses.Luke 11:46: Woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.Luke 12:14: Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
verses.Luke 12:15: Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
verses.Luke 12:18: This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.
verses.Luke 12:22: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.
verses.Luke 12:54: When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.
verses.Luke 13:12: Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.
verses.Luke 13:20: Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
verses.Luke 13:32: Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.
verses.Luke 14:30: This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
verses.Luke 15:11: A certain man had two sons:
verses.Luke 15:27: Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
verses.Luke 15:31: Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
verses.Luke 16:1: There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
verses.Luke 16:6: Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
verses.Luke 16:7: An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.
verses.Luke 16:15: Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
verses.Luke 16:27: I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:
verses.Luke 16:30: Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.
verses.Luke 16:31: If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
verses.Luke 17:14: Go shew yourselves unto the priests.
verses.Luke 17:19: Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.Luke 17:20: The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
verses.Luke 17:22: The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
verses.Luke 17:37: Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.
verses.Luke 18:2: There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:
verses.Luke 18:19: Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.
verses.Luke 18:22: Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
verses.Luke 18:24: How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.Luke 18:27: The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
verses.Luke 18:29: Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,
verses.Luke 18:41: What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee?
verses.Luke 18:42: Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.
verses.Luke 19:5: Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.
verses.Luke 19:9: This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.Luke 19:17: Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.
verses.Luke 19:19: Be thou also over five cities.
verses.Luke 19:22: Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:
verses.Luke 19:24: Take from him the pound, and give it to him that hath ten pounds.
verses.Luke 19:30: Go ye into the village over against you; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring him hither.
verses.Luke 19:40: I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.
verses.Luke 19:42: If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things which belong unto thy peace! but now they are hid from thines eyes.
verses.Luke 19:46: It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.Luke 20:3: I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
verses.Luke 20:8: Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.Luke 20:24: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it?
verses.Luke 20:25: Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar's, and unto God the things which be God's.
verses.Luke 20:41: How say they that Christ is David's son?
verses.Luke 21:3: Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:
verses.Luke 21:8: Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.
verses.Luke 22:10: Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.
verses.Luke 22:15: With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:
verses.Luke 22:25: The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.
verses.Luke 22:34: I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.
verses.Luke 22:35: When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing?
verses.Luke 22:40: Pray that ye enter not into temptation.
verses.Luke 22:42: Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
verses.Luke 22:46: Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.
verses.Luke 22:48: Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
verses.Luke 22:52: Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?
verses.Luke 22:67: If I tell you, ye will not believe:
verses.Luke 23:34: Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do.
verses.Luke 23:43: Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.
verses.Luke 23:46: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit:
verses.Luke 24:17: What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?
verses.Luke 24:25: O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:
verses.Luke 24:38: Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
verses.Luke 24:44: These are the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.
verses.John 1:42: Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas.
verses.John 1:48: Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.
verses.John 1:50: Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.
verses.John 1:51: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
verses.John 2:4: Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
verses.John 2:8: Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast.
verses.John 2:16: Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise.
verses.John 2:19: Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
verses.John 3:3: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
verses.John 3:5: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.John 3:10: Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?
verses.John 4:10: If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
verses.John 4:13: Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:
verses.John 4:16: Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
verses.John 4:17: Thou hast well said, I have no husband:
verses.John 4:21: Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.
verses.John 4:26: I that speak unto thee am he.
verses.John 4:32: I have meat to eat that ye know not of.
verses.John 4:34: My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
verses.John 4:48: Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.
verses.John 4:50: Go thy way; thy son liveth.
verses.John 5:8: Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.
verses.John 5:14: Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
verses.John 5:17: My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.
verses.John 6:5: Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?
verses.John 6:12: Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.
verses.John 6:26: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.
verses.John 6:29: This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.
verses.John 6:32: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.
verses.John 6:35: I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
verses.John 6:53: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.
verses.John 6:65: Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.
verses.John 6:70: Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?
verses.John 7:6: My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.
verses.John 7:16: and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.
verses.John 7:21: I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
verses.John 7:33: Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go unto him that sent me.
verses.John 8:10: Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?
verses.John 8:11: Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.
verses.John 8:14: Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.
verses.John 8:19: Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
verses.John 8:23: Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.
verses.John 8:25: Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.
verses.John 8:28: When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.
verses.John 8:34: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
verses.John 8:39: If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
verses.John 8:42: If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
verses.John 8:49: I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
verses.John 8:54: If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:
verses.John 8:58: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
verses.John 9:3: Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
verses.John 9:7: Go, wash in the pool of Siloam.
verses.John 9:35: Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
verses.John 9:37: Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.
verses.John 9:39: For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.
verses.John 9:41: If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
verses.John 10:25: I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father's name, they bear witness of me.
verses.John 10:32: Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?
verses.John 10:34: Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
verses.John 11:4: This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.
verses.John 11:7: Let us go into Judaea again.
verses.John 11:9: Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
verses.John 11:25: I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:
verses.John 11:40: Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?
verses.John 11:44: Loose him, and let him go.
verses.John 12:7: Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.
verses.John 12:23: The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.
verses.John 12:30: This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.
verses.John 12:35: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
verses.John 13:7: What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.
verses.John 13:8: If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.
verses.John 13:10: He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.
verses.John 13:12: Know ye what I have done to you?
verses.John 13:26: He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when I have dipped it.
verses.John 13:31: Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.
verses.John 13:36: Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.
verses.John 13:38: Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.
verses.John 14:6: I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
verses.John 14:9: Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou then, Shew us the Father?
verses.John 14:23: If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.
verses.John 18:8: I have told you that I am he: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:
verses.John 18:11: Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?
verses.John 18:20: I spake openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort; and in secret have I said nothing.
verses.John 18:23: If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?
verses.John 18:34: Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?
verses.John 18:36: My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.
verses.John 18:37: Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.
verses.John 19:11: Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.
verses.John 20:15: Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou?
verses.John 20:17: Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and to my God, and your God.
verses.John 20:29: Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
verses.John 21:6: Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find.
verses.John 21:10: Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.
verses.John 21:16: Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me?
verses.John 21:22: If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.
verses.John 21:23: If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?
verses.Acts 1:7: It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.
verses.Acts 9:4: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.Acts 9:5: I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
verses.Acts 9:6: Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.
verses.Acts 22:7: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.Acts 22:8: I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
verses.Acts 22:10: Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
verses.Acts 26:14: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
verses.Acts 26:15: I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
verses.Revelation 1:11: I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What thou seest, write in a book, and send it unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.
verses.Revelation 1:17: Fear not; I am the first and the last:
verses.Revelation 2:1: These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;
verses.Revelation 2:8: These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;
verses.Revelation 2:12: These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges;
verses.Revelation 2:18: These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet are like fine brass;
verses.Revelation 3:1: These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.
verses.Revelation 3:7: These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;
verses.Revelation 3:14: These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;
verses.Revelation 16:15: Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he that watcheth, and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.
verses.Revelation 21:5: Behold, I make all things new.
verses.Revelation 21:6: It is done. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.
verses.Revelation 22:7: Behold, I come quickly: blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book.
